items.summary: Issues related to banking, bank guarantees, and the impact of quality control orders were also highlighted by the MSME associations, seeking remedial measures.

items.title: India emerges as global hub for Media Capability Centres
items.summary: India is becoming the top choice for global media companies establishing capability centres. These centres are crucial for production, post-production, and analytics. Driven by a vast talent pool and technological advancements, India offers significant cost savings. Major companies are investing heavily, creating high-value jobs and positioning India as a global innovation hub for entertainment.

items.title: Mobile sales ring loudly as shipments reach five-year high
items.summary: India’s smartphone shipments reached a five-year high of 48 million, growing 4% on-year during the festive third quarter of 2025, driven by strong demand for premium models. Momentum, however, was offset by weaker demand for entry-level Android smartphones and rising prices due to component costs.

items.title: Alta Capital checks into Isprava's luxury homes with $100 mn investment
items.summary: Isprava Group, a leader in Goa's luxury real estate, is set to receive an Rs 850-crore investment from Alta Capital. This significant funding will fuel expansion into popular vacation spots like Goa and Alibaug. The investment will also enable international offerings for ultra-rich clients and provide exits for early investors. Alta Capital will become a major shareholder post-transaction.

items.title: Indian cinema mines myths to tell 'cultural' stories
items.summary: Bollywood is witnessing a rise in films inspired by Indian mythology and history. Several epic and historical movies are set for release, reflecting a renewed interest in cultural narratives. Audiences are embracing stories that blend contemporary themes with ancient tales. This trend highlights a growing desire to connect with cultural roots and celebrate cinematic grandeur.

items.title: Business Payments Firm Bill Holdings Is Exploring a Sale
items.summary: Bill Holdings Inc., the business-payments firm under pressure from activist investor Starboard Value LP, is exploring options including a potential sale, people familiar with the matter said.

items.title: Kinara Capital plans fundraise from strategic investors amid debt recast of about Rs 1,150 crore
items.summary: Kinara Capital is negotiating a debt recast with international lenders for approximately ₹1,150 crore. The company is also finalizing a one-time settlement with domestic lenders. Kinara aims to raise about ₹200 crore from strategic investors to strengthen its capital base. The firm has stopped new lending and is focusing on collections.

items.title: Life insurers see surge in pure protection demand as GST 2.0 makes term plans affordable
items.summary: Life insurers are experiencing a surge in demand for pure protection products. This follows the government's decision to remove GST on individual term insurance. Companies like HDFC Life, Axis Max Life, and SBI Life report significant growth in their protection segments. This trend is expected to continue, making term insurance more affordable and accessible for first-time buyers.

items.title: 'Plan to boost export of goods made by tribals': Piyush Goyal
items.summary: A new government initiative aims to boost the export of goods crafted by tribal communities. This plan will harness the power of e-commerce and set up international warehouses where these unique products can be displayed and sold to a global audience.

items.title: Royalty rates on 4 key minerals rationalised
items.summary: ​​The royalty rates for caesium and rubidium have been set at 2% of the average sale price (ASP), applicable to the metal contained in the produced ore. For zirconium, the royalty rate has been fixed at 1%.

items.title: At pre-budget meet, MSMEs seek cheaper credit, policy support to stay competitive amid US tariffs
items.summary: ​​The meeting also focussed on ways to create export hubs and more clusters for small enterprises to ship out goods more efficiently. It was the minister's third pre-budget meeting with key stakeholders, after her huddle with economists and farm sector representatives on Monday.

items.title: India, Saudi Arabia reaffirm commitment to conclude bilateral investment treaty soon
items.summary: Senior government officials had said India was pursuing BITs with over a dozen countries, including Saudi Arabia, Qatar, Israel, Oman, the EU, Switzerland, Russia, and Australia. The move is part of the broader efforts by the government to draw foreign investors at a time when the country is moving fast towards emerging as the world's third-largest economy. The government is also taking steps to boost investments in manufacturing.

items.title: In last 6 months, India’s biggest anti-terror crackdown: Explosives, drone weapons and radical network spread across states busted
items.summary: In a six-month nationwide crackdown, India’s security forces have dismantled multiple terror modules linked to JeM, AGH, ISIS, and TTP. Nearly 2,900 kg of explosives, drone-supplied weapons, and digital radicalisation networks were uncovered in coordinated raids across states. The government has stepped up vigilance, vowing zero tolerance for terrorism.

items.title: Hudco plans $1 billion pooled fund to finance metro projects: CMD
items.summary: HUDCO, or the Housing and Urban Development Corporation Limited, is making waves by planning a transformative investment aimed at enhancing India's metro network. Currently in conversation with multilateral banks, the organization seeks to assemble a pooled fund of over one billion dollars.

items.title: Cabinet okays Rs 45,000 crore package to support exports, MSMEs amid global headwinds
items.summary: The Indian government has launched an ambitious ₹45,000 crore package to invigorate the country's export landscape. This extensive initiative features a visionary six-year Export Promotion Mission alongside a ₹20,000 crore collateral-free Guarantee Scheme for Exporters.

items.title: Govt reviews performance of public sector lenders; AI, digital banking in focus
items.summary: The finance ministry reviewed public sector banks' performance for H1 FY26, noting a net profit of  ₹93,675 crore. Improvements in asset quality were observed, and banks showcased advancements in digital banking.

items.title: HDFC Capital makes second exit from Rs 2,500-cr Adarsh Developers platform

This marks a significant milestone for both entities, demonstrating successful value creation. The collaboration has supported Adarsh Developers in launching new projects and strengthening its financial standing.

items.title: Cabinet declares Red Fort blast a terrorist act, vows zero tolerance; passes resolution on explosion near Red Fort in Delhi
items.summary: The Union Cabinet on November 12 formally designated the car explosion near Delhi’s Red Fort as a terrorist act, expressing deep sorrow over the loss of lives and reaffirming India’s zero-tolerance policy towards terrorism. The government passed a resolution condemning the attack and ordered an immediate probe to bring those responsible to justice.

items.title: 'Commercial business name is...': Tata Motors issues clarification on CV unit

HDFC Capital's strategy focuses on partnering with top developers to finance quality homes for mid-income households. Both entities are expected to continue their collaboration on remaining projects.

items.title: Sustain low-cost deposit momentum: Finmin to PSBs
items.summary: In the initial half of FY26, state-owned banks showcased impressive profitability alongside a decline in bad loan ratios. The finance ministry encouraged these institutions to attract more low-cost deposits and boost lending to MSMEs and the agriculture sector. Additionally, banks received recommendations to bolster their risk management frameworks and accelerate their digital transformation efforts.

items.title: India's power grid struggles to absorb soaring solar supply
items.summary: The curtailment rate for solar generation in October rose to about 12%, the highest since May when Grid Controller of India Ltd. began publishing such data. On some days, as much as 40% of solar power output was denied access to the national grid. Curtailment measures the share of electricity generated but not delivered to consumers.

They discussed the progress being made on the Canada-India joint road map, which sets out a plan to enhance cooperation in key areas, including energy, trade and people-to-people ties, according to the statement.

items.summary: Flight cancellations in the U.S. have significantly decreased. This improvement comes as air traffic control absences are reducing. The Federal Aviation Administration is easing flight cut requirements. Delays have also dropped dramatically. Air traffic controllers will receive back pay soon after the shutdown ends. The aviation system is expected to return to normal this weekend.

items.summary: According to Geojit, Global consumption of edible oils is expected to fall 30-40% in 2020 because of coronavirus lockdowns, said Dominic Xavier, Middle East and North Africa region head at Sime Darby Oils.

items.title: Oil falls further amid growing alarm over coronavirus second wave
items.summary: The biggest global health crisis in a century continues to flare unabated with cases rising in India, Great Britain, Spain and several parts of the United States, where the infection rate has not come under control for months.

items.title: Gold flat as dollar strength counters safe-haven demand
items.summary: Spot gold was little changed at $1,929.30 per ounce by 0038 GMT, after falling to a near two-week week low of $1,906.24 on Tuesday.

items.title: Gold may witness choppy trade, expect buying at lower levels: Kotak Securities
items.summary: After weeks of consolidation, crude oil has come under pressure amid signs of correction in US equity market and gains in US dollar index.

items.title: Energy Weekly Report: Motilal Oswal
items.summary: According to Motilal Oswal, Oil prices hit a rough patch last week, falling back in line with broader financial markets. Prices did try to inch higher, but experienced selling pressure at highs.

items.title: Precious Metals Weekly Report: Motilal Oswal
items.summary: According to Motilal Oswal, Gold fell to the lowest level in a month primarily as the dollar rose against its major crosses and better-than-expected economic number from the US.

items.title: Base Metals Weekly Report: Motilal Oswal
items.summary: According to Motilal Oswal, Base metals traded choppy last week, with prices hitting multi month highs at the start of the week and followed by some profit taking on back of volatility in the dollar and mixed data signals from China and US.

items.title: Flipkart records highest-ever single day sale, grosses $200mn
items.summary: This is the biggest ever single day sale for Bangalore-based Flipkart, since the time the company started in 2007.

items.title: Subramanian Swamy seeks ban on import of cement from Pakistan
items.summary: "Allowing imports of cement from Pakistan, therefore, carried with it the additional risk in that it provides an effective cover for smuggling of contraband goods and harmful weapons and ammunition concealed in cement bags which comes in rakes and trucks, in the hands of disruptionist elements," he said.

items.title: Moneycontrol Exclusive: Govt plans overhaul of tax administration for smooth GST rollout
items.summary: The government has readied plans for a major change in India’s tax administration structure, including overhauling the Central Board of Excise and Customs (CBEC) to ensure a glitch-free roll-out of a nation-wide goods and services tax (GST).

items.title: Sensex, Nifty wobbly; Hind Zinc, SBI, Force Motors most active
items.summary: Asian Paints, SBI, Tata Motors, HUL and Maruti Suzuki are top gainers while ONGC, Axis Bank, MM, Bajaj Auto and Hero MotoCorp are major losers in the Sensex.

items.title: Uber  redBus partner with ixigo for train travellers
items.summary: ixigo, India’s leading mobile travel marketplace has announced partnerships with Uber and redBus to enable instant bookings for cabs and buses natively within ixigo trains app.

items.title: Workload in IT to come down due to AI; jobs to reduce: Genpact
items.summary: But along with that the employment growth rates have started to dip, NV 'Tiger' Tyagarajan says. The percentage addition of employees in India will not be same as past. And due to advancements, a workforce with higher skill sets is required for the IT industry, he says.

items.title: Pixel launch: Is Google Assistant's AI an assault on privacy?
items.summary: Sure, artificial intelligence can make life simpler by suggesting you places to eat, tell you weather, or even crack a joke.  The more you use it, the more it learns about your habits and preferences. The protocols pertaining to artificial intelligence, or the lack of it, make our data less secure and more vulnerable.

items.title: Up over 200% in 1 year, what's buzzing with Borosil Glass?
items.summary: Shares of Borosil Glass Works have increased threefold over the past one year as the company has posted strong revenue and EBIDTA growth over the past few quarters.

items.title: Why you should not be always chasing returns
items.summary: Most people focus on returns and chase products that offer the best returns at any point.

items.title: Jhunjhunwala-partnered fund buys stake in TFCI: What's buzzing?
items.summary: In an interview with CNBC-TV18, Satpal Arora, MD of Tourism Finance Corporation of India (TFCI), talked about the state of business and the outlook ahead.

items.title: RBI latest meeting 'diluted' its old policy framework: Nomura
items.summary: On Tuesday, the central bank surprised the market with a 25-basis-point cut to its policy repo rate, or the rate at which it lends to banks, to 6.25 percent.

items.title: Bond bull market may pause but is far from over: Expert
items.summary: The benchmark 10-year government-security yield remained stuck in 8-7.5 percent range through all of 2015 and half of 2016, moving lower to sub-7 percent only when the RBI promised in April to reduce the system's liquidity deficit. The yield may now fall more.

items.title: Scope for meaningful rate cuts going ahead: Neelkanth Mishra
items.summary: Credit Suisse' Neelkanth Mishra expects repo rate to fall to a decade low in the coming quarters. He says that beginning December the market may see a robust and widespread pick-up which may boost indices.

items.summary: Sensors, 3D printed skin, wearables, reconstructed organs, revolutionized clinical trials, personalized medicine and what not – get ready for a new era of healthcare

items.title: Steel stocks rally as govt extends MIP on 66 steel products
items.summary: Stocks like Hindustan Zinc, Hindalco, Jindal Steel, JSW Steel and Tata Steel gained over 1 percent from previous close.

items.title: Endurance Technologies IPO opens: Should you subscribe?
items.summary: The Aurangabad-based company aims to mop up nearly Rs 1,162 crore (at higher end of price band) by diluting 17.5 percent stake through the issue that will close on October 7. It already raised Rs 348.52 crore through anchor investors' portion on Tuesday, the day before issue opening.

items.title: Cautiously optimistic on India; eyeing earnings revival: Sanger
items.summary: Global liquidity tailwinds are unlikely to get any better from now and that makes Arvind Sanger, Managing Partner at Geosphere Capital Management “cautiously optimistic” on the Indian markets.

items.title: Automation threatens 69% jobs in India: World Bank
items.summary: "In large parts of Africa, it is likely that technology could fundamentally disrupt this pattern. Research based on World Bank data has predicted that the proportion of jobs threatened in India by automation is 69 percent, in China it is 77 percent and in Ethiopia, the percentage of jobs threatened by automation is 85 percent," he said.
